pages.text: Academic Using deep learning to detect ophthalmic diseases, 2021 Traditionally, ophthalmologists had to take images from patients' eye with specific instruments, and analyze those images manually to detect any possible anomaly in the eye. The goal of project was to exploit deep learning methods to do the detection phase automatically. That is deep layers of neurons will be trained to classify images obtained from ophthalmology instruments. The results show that a well tuned deep network along with a large enough dataset can accurately detect the anomalies. This model in turn can be used in smartphones to help opticians in the disorder detection. Vibration analysis from raw sensory data, 2017 The goal of this project was to process raw data from an accelerometer to extract velocity and displacement types of vibration. These values in turn would be used to stop a mission-critial operation in certain vibration levels (say 30 mm/s). Major challenges in this project were applying suitable digital filters to clean noisy acceleration signal, and doing appropriate differentiation on the data to extract velocity and displacement information. All of the algorithms first simulated on MATLAB, then transformed to C code to run on a Cortex-M4F microcontroller. From Industry Android system modifying to filter unauthorized external devices, 2020 A modification on the android external device management, a.k.a Volume Manager or VOLD, performed to authorize devices that are introduced privously to the system. Authorized devices must be added in a whitelist database by the admin. Unauthorized devices couldn't create device files in the target filesystem. This modification could be useful for customized android systems in critical infrastructures such as vehicles or building management systems that might be vulnerable to malicious external devices. ExpressIO: A fast and highly reliable signal conditioner system, 2018 Gas turbine controller system constitues of multiple layers including the main processors (CPUs), sensors to gather status of mechanical parts, actuators to perform mechanical actions, and intermediate signal conditioner system(s) to convey information between CPUs and sensor/actuators. It is obvious that all of these levels should meet a certain level of speed, accuracy, and reliability. Otherwise the whole of the system could fail. ExpressIO is a fast and robust signal conditioner system with a variety of I/Os including digital I/Os, analog I/Os, and high precision counters. This system provide high robustness by having redundancies both in its hardware and software architecture. In the software, it benefits of a FreeRTOS kernel to meet real-time constrained tasks with a whole response time of 2ms. Also, it has two redundant Profibus tarnsmission channels to exchange information with industrial CPUs. This product is currently operational in some power plant units in Iran. pages.text: Shourabi, M., & Noori, H. (2021). Design Space Exploration based on deep learning and hardware performance counters to predict the optimal configuration of a soft-core processor. Abstract Click on this to see abstract. By the ever-increasing complexity of hardware processing architectures, CAD tools, and low-level simulation techniques no more can address the design gap issue. So, the need for high-level prediction will be more tangible. This paper presents a methodology to help designers find the optimum energy-consuming configuration of a softcore processor at a glance and with appreciable accuracy. The proposed framework extracts the integrated performance counters information within a softcore. Then, it uses deep learning to find a relation between the execution time of a given application and the hardware configuration. Using integrated performance counters can highly reduce intrinsic errors of simulation methods due to being tightly coupled to the hardware. By combining the performance estimation technique with static power information of the hardware, we proposed OEPM, a model that can offer the best configuration of softcore in terms of energy consumption for a given C source code. Our results reach the mean prediction error rates of below 1.5% for unseen applications

pages.text: Note: These are my non-professional study interests! Winning by Jack Welch This is the best book ever I have read. Jack Welch is a former CEO of general electric. He is famous for his strcit attitude in leadership. During his period, GE market value increase from $12bn to more than $400bn. He wrote this book not to make profit, and I think this is a key differene with the casual success books in the market. The book starts with a spectacular opening, when Welch defines his own interpretation of winning, and says why you should win. The book has a lot of key factors of how to be a good leader in your organization. However, I think most of them are applicable to our everyday lives. For instance, Welch emphesizes on having candor. He says that only candor can eliminate killing bureaucracies within an organizations. Candor speeds up processes, removes misunderstandings, and increses achievements. I can roughly devide my life into two parts. The days before trying candor and the days after. I believe that my biggest achievements are from the time I started to use candor in my everyday life. It had great impacts both on my career and personal life. You should read the book! Deep Work Project Management Make your bed Time Management
